title: Why isn't the full game chat of logs shown when you are penalized?
body: I just got a 10 game chat restriction, and just got me wondering why isn't everyone else's chat logs shown... These people were toxic to me back? Doesn't make sense.

replies.body: You get punished based on your actions, not on everybody else's actions

Because you don't agree to not be toxic unless provoked, you agree to not be toxic. Therefore other players' actions have no bearing on your punishment. There's no "but he started it" defence in league.
Becausw you're responsible for your actions not theirs and if its as bad as you think they were probably punished too.

Because if they put the entire conversation, most people would agree you were justified in telling that douche bag off.  So they only include what you said.  

It's Riots attempt to parent you.  Just type "I Understand" and move on with your life.  You already have parents, you don't need a new one.
Explain then why, when Tribunal showed the full game logs, toxicity was punished regardless of if the player started it or not?

It was not punished near to the current standard.  As long as you didn't go over the top under the old Tribunal System ... you didn't tend to get in near as much trouble.

Also note I said the average person - not the Tribunal ... or any of League's thought police who have been instructed as to their role.

It... Actually was punished the same as it is now.

Tribunal was literally regular players, from across all MMRs, who weren't given any instructions whatsoever. They were shown logs and told vote punish or not punish.

Toxicity was overwhelmingly voted punish regardless of who started it.

I don't remember hearing near this much about toxicity back in those days.  Didn't hear near as much QQing either.  **I welcome the Tribunal's return.**

Also, from what I remember ... the Tribunal was "paid" in RP and skins ... and whether or not you were invited back to the tribunal was roughly how you voted.  If you constantly voted "not punish" your chances to stay on the Tribunal was pretty low.

No, the Tribunal was **NEVER** paid with RP or skins, and only for a **brief** time was there a minimal (I think 5 or 50) IP (the predecessor to BE) reward for players who had voted with the majority in a lot of cases.

There was no "invite" to the tribunal, and players were only removed if they had a **long** track record of voting **against** the majority where the majority was virtually unanimous - i.e. if someone consistently voted "not punish", even on cases where 98+% were voting punish - because that was seen as indicative of them not looking at the cases but just spam voting. The number of players removed from tribunal was very low - anyone who wanted to and had not been recently punished could participate.

You could vote not punish all you want if you truly believed it was not punishable - and you wouldn't be removed - unless you voted not punish just to troll the Tribunal.
What does majority decision have to do with anything? Someone being toxic is subjective, so you rewarded players for being sheep and not thinking for themselves. Horrible reward system.

> [{quoted}](name=ADRrat,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=MQJagZQI,comment-id=0001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-06-19T17:54:15.099+0000)

> What does majority decision have to do with anything? Someone being toxic is subjective, so you rewarded players for being sheep and not thinking for themselves. Horrible reward system.

You never saw how other players voted; no tally or bar showing if you voted with or against the majority.

The earliest Tribunal cases did include full chat logs. It... didn't actually have as big an effect as current players think.  When they switched to only showing the reported players' logs, it didn't significantly change voting patterns. That's a big part of where the 'context doesn't matter' come from.  It ultimately comes from *our* opinions.

As far as the IP, it was 5 per *correct* vote. which means it would take 90 accurate decisions to get just one 450 champion, and 1260 accurate decisions for a 6300 champion. The return was low enough, it wasn't hard to spot vote spamming 'reward hunters' and accuracy actually went up when IP was no longer offered.

Man... what kinds of rumor have you been hearing...

The tribunal gave  incentive for those who voted correctly IP. If you vote incorrectly, you won't get IP.

But in the case of Tribunal, it was people who have been through the situations themselves, and could show sympathy. To say the punishments were the same as they are now is just wrong. There is no empathy/sympathy/reason with the current system, it is either "You said something reportable or you didn't", its black and white, at least with tribunal you had a gray area of chance. I know this will be downvoted cause im disagreeing with a Advisor, but to be honest I believe him to be wrong in this case.  Real players can spot situations where a player breaks after constant harassment, a machine can only spot that they broke...period...and punish them for it.

The issue is people **didn't** show sympathy in Tribunal. They **didn't** vote "not punish" just because someone else was behaving bad. Overwhelmingly, the Tribunal voted to punish toxicity **regardless** of what else was going on in the game.

That's one reason Riot went to automated system - players didn't care what else was going on - they said toxicity was toxicity and was bad regardless.

Looking back you might be right about that, but I do remember cases where the tribunal came together to help a bro out. Usually the first people to vote decided the players fate, cause people would just vote what had the higher amount. But I think now, tribunal would work better, considering id say about 50% of the player base has accrued some sort of punishment, or dealt with situations. They would relate to and actually help the player base, instead of raw bans and suspensions without context. I know that would mean faith in this extremely toxic community, but little changes  that get the player base involved more with the game outside of the Rift would really help the community.

There were **very** few of those cases. And honestly, comparatively, I would bet that Player Support has been more willing to give those chances/"help a bro out" more than Tribunal was.

And no, people couldn't vote the higher amount, because the votes were not shown until after the player voted.

FYI, less than 20% of the player base has ever gotten one punishment, let alone any bans (bans being less than 5% of the player base), and only 0.006% have been permanently banned.

Tribunal was removed because players *weren't* using it to vote - cases took months to be voted on and by the time they were players had either ruined hundreds/thousands more games or the punishment was for games the player wouldn't even remember playing. There's no reason to go back to that system when the current system is, for all intents and purposes, the same result.

Well now I have some real numbers to work with lol. 
Lets say you are an addict to something, and you go to a remedial place for said addiction. Wouldn't you rather connect with 1 out of 5 people there, then nobody. 20% might not seem like a lot, but in a game with a few million players, it is. I would rather have a chance of being judged by somebody who went through my struggles, then being judged by a computer program. I know the tribunal had MANY flaws, but the ideal for it was so much better. And honestly, seeing so many people beg for it back, Riot could always just give us a chance to do right by it this time around.

Because irrelevant information really isn't necessary and it forces you to focus on YOUR chat and how to improve YOUR chat. If you were able to justify everything you said in your head, you would never really learn the rules. You would play a game with yourself that Riot isn't participating in. The point of punishments is for you to learn the rules and follow them. It's not some lesson in morality. They're simply showing you where you broke the rules, so that you can prevent it in the future. It would just cause confusion if kids were able to over analyze their logs and justify it. The whole point would be lost on them.
you are responsible for your behaviors and reactions. two wrongs don't make it right (aka doesn't matter who started it)
The short answer is that what anyone else does is irrelevant. There's nothing anyone can say or do that makes toxic chat become okay.

Simply because in most cases, toxicity comes after being flamed. If you could show that you were harassed and then retaliated, youd be able to make solid cases for yourself in terms of relieving the bans/suspensions whatever. However, the system is blind to reasons, if you do anything toxic or along those lines, youre done. Riot doesn't care about the reason. You can be victim all game, for 30 minutes get flamed, and if you say one thing back you are then reportable, and the system doesn't care about the rest of the game, only that you did something wrong. Personal opinion, poor system, lets get tribunal back. But yeah, they don't show full logs cause then when you post them here people might actually agree with you lol.

Hello, Tribunal user here. Even back during the Tribunal days when both ally and enemy chat was shown the vast majority of the time it didn't change the outcome of the case at all whatsoever, and in some cases even served to work against the player in question. The IFS (which was built in part with data gathered from the Tribunal) only shows the defendants logs because only their behavior is being judged in their case and no one elses, hence why context doesn't matter here. It's supposed to encourage people to look at their own behavior and where they might have gone wrong at rather than look for someone else to blame for their mistakes.

idk who downvoted you, so I gave you an upvote. Also, vast majority is different than all, and that matters to players like me. There is a breaking point for everybody, and mine is relatively high, and when I get flamed for an early game mistake for the next 25 minutes, and I type in chat, "Can you guys stfu and play the damn game", and then get hit with a chat ban, I feel like a player review would help me out more than a black and white automated report system. (This has legit happened, the only logs shown were "glhf" and that)

I always remove the auto-upvote from my posts to get a better idea of how many people like or dislike my posts. It's not perfect I know but there you go.

As for your punishment in particular if that was all you said then you wouldn't have been punished, which means there's more to the story that you're not telling. I would highly advise you to make your own thread and post your entire unedited Reform Card in it. Yes everyone has a breaking point but it requires multiple instances of poor behavior across multiple games or a violation of the zero-tolerance policy to receive a punishment. If you must rage then just do so at the screen instead of in the chat, thereby letting you vent your frustrations without compromising your teams chances of success.

The logs are there not (just) as evidence, but as a tool for you use in order to avoid future punishments.
Only your behaviour is in your control, so it focusses on that.

I believe the automated system can only handle a workload.. and the algorithms are nowhere near human level intelligence. Adding in more human ques to comprehend would require more work/money. Leaving out context makes it simple and quick to pass judgement. There are millions of players playing this game, if a few thousand go missing every week who will notice?

Because they dont matter.
Youre responsible for your actions, and apparently other faceless peoples actions as well. Since giving someone the "kys" treatment is bannable.

Because league doesn't understand basic things like responding. Basically just mute everyone at the start of every game and do your thing if you are someone who responds to trolls like me. I cant just sit there and take getting question mark spammed cuz my jungle dove the adc and support, but if you comment on it you get banned, so mute everyone's messages, pings,  and emotes and move on. Of course your game play will suffer as you cant see correspondence from others, but it will stop you from getting banned in the long run.
